Articles.Content:
Is it just me or did this patch put the center of gravity 800 miles to the left? I dont know but I have been playing this game for a while and I have never seen my rockets do acrobatics so hard before. You launch and 5 seconds later it has done a 180 and is nose diving down to the ground.

I have never found it so hard to go into orbit before. Any rocket that is strong enough to get into orbit flips over and any rocket small enough to fly strait wont make it.

This has been posted elsewhere:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_q_8TO4Ag0E?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Does this video help at all or are you still having problems? Seeing your rocket will make determining problems much easier.
workaround: spam the fins ( mind the CoL / CoM tho )
Stop turning 90 degrees in one swoop and you'll be fine.
Turning needs to be a lot more gradual now. Keep your steering vector near or inside the prograde vector.
